[[Barcelona]], [[Spain]] | capacity = 1,500 | chairman = {{flagicon|Spain}} [[Daniel SÃ¡nchez Llibre]] | manager = {{flagicon|Spain}} RaÃºl Longhi | league = [[Tercera DivisiÃ³n|3Âª â Group 5]] | season = 2010â11| position = [[Tercera DivisiÃ³n|3Âª â Group 5]], '''5th''' | pattern_la1=_espanyol1011h|pattern_b1=_espanyol1011h|pattern_ra1=_espanyol1011h | leftarm1=FFFFFF|body1=FFFFFF|rightarm1=FFFFFF|shorts1=0000CD|socks1=0000CD|pattern_so1=_top_on_white | pattern_la2=_espanyol1011a|pattern_b2=_espanyol1011a|pattern_ra2=_espanyol1011a | leftarm2=000000|body2=000000|rightarm2=000000|shorts2=000000|socks2=C0C0C0|pattern_so2=_hoops_black }} '''Reial Club Deportiu Espanyol de Barcelona B, S.A.D.''' is a [[List of football clubs in Spain|Spanish football club]] based in [[Barcelona]], in the autonomous community of [[Catalonia]]. Founded in 1981, it is the [[reserve team]] of [[RCD Espanyol]] and plays in ''[[Tercera DivisiÃ³n]]'', holding home matches at ''[[Ciutat Esportiva de Sant AdriÃ ]]'', with a 1,500-seat capacity. Unlike the [[English football league system|English League]], reserve teams in Spain play in the same football pyramid as their senior team rather than a separate league. However, reserve teams cannot play in the same division as their senior team, also not being able (although it was possible in the past) to compete in the [[Copa del Rey]]. ==History== In 1981, ''Futbol Club Cristinenc'' was created in [[Santa Cristina d'Aro]], [[Province of Girona]]. The club had a speedy progression through the lower divisions until it reached the [[Tercera DivisiÃ³n|fourth category]]. Meanwhile, it had also become a [[Farm team|feeder club]] for [[RCD Espanyol|RCD EspaÃ±ol]]. In 1991, the team changed its denomination to ''Cristinenc-Espanyol'', being re-named Real Club Deportivo Espanyol B three years later, while also gaining [[reserve team]] status for EspaÃ±ol. It fluctuated between the fourth and the [[Segunda DivisiÃ³n B|third levels]] in the following decades, the longest spell being five years, with a second position in the [[2001â02 Segunda DivisiÃ³n B|2001â02 season]]; in its three visits to the playoffs, the [[Catalonia|Catalan]] outfit subsequently failed to promote. In [[2009â10 Segunda DivisiÃ³n B|2009â10]], Espanyol B finished in 16th position, above the relegation zone. It dropped down a division, however, in the relegation playoffs. ==Season to season== {| |valign="top" width=0%| {| class="wikitable" |- style="background:#f0f6fa;" !'''Season''' !'''Division'''
